Static evaluation of a position.

Imports

board, movegen, templates

Consts

CHECKMATE_SCORE = 20000
CHECKMATE_BOUND = 19000

Procs

proc eval(board: Board; history: array[512, Board]; ply: int; depth: int): int {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Evaluates the positions including cecking for draws by stalemate and 3fold repetition. Actually even a 2fold repetition is considerd a draw (there's no disadvantage in that).

Funcs

func rookVsKingEval(board: Board): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
In the KRK endgame, evaluates the position based on how much roaming space the losing king has and the distance between the kings. 
func pieceImprovement(piece: Piece; frm, to: Square; color: Color): int {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Determines a noncapture piece improvement when moving from frm to to for the purpose of move ordering. Castling has a bonus. 
func eval_piece(board: Board; phase: int; color: Color; piece: Piece): int {...}{.inline,
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Calculates the evaluation over all piece of a given color and given type. 
func eval_pawns(board: Board; color: Color): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Calculates the evaluation of pawns. This piece type is special, since we consider the pawn structure too. TODO: give bonus to pawn chains. TODO: give bonus to king shelter (maybe in king func) 
func eval_king(board: Board; phase: int; color: Color): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Calculates the evaluation of king. TODO penalty for destroying castling rights? 
func eval_mg(board: Board): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Evaluate the aspects that depend on gameProgress, as if it was middlegame. 
func eval_eg(board: Board): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Evaluate the aspects that depend on gameProgress, as if it was endgame. 
func eval_unif(board: Board): int {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Evaluates the aspects that don't depend on game progress. 
func count_material(board: Board): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Counts material for the purpose of game phase in time management. 
func evalAprox(board: Board): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
TODO: fast approximation of a evaluation. Perhaps only using popcounts and piece values independent of squares. Perhaps this could be used in a more sophisticated search scheme. 
func formatScore(board: Board; score: int): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Formats the score for printing. Negamax type of score is converted to objective values, value is converted from centipawns to pawns and forced mate scores are displayed as full moves until mate. Further more if a score was not calculated at all (perhaps there was only a single root move), "?" is returned.
